channel.title: Acafeed Generated Feed
channel.description: This feed is generated by Acafeed.

item.title: Parallel stopped-flow interrogation of diverse biological systems at the single-molecule scale
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 02 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02944-4

Parallelized single-molecule fluorescence and single-molecule FRET experiments enable quantitative biophysics investigations of molecular function from multiple samples in a single experiment.

item.title: CaBLAM: a high-contrast bioluminescent Ca2+ indicator derived from an engineered Oplophorus gracilirostris luciferase
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 02 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02972-0

CaBLAM is a bioluminescent genetically encoded calcium indicator that delivers high-contrast signals as shown in cell culture, in the in vivo mouse brain and in zebrafish larvae.

item.title: Atom-level enzyme active site scaffolding using RFdiffusion2
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 03 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02975-x

RFdiffusion2, an extension of the RFdiffusion framework, builds de novo enzyme active sites using atom-level functional group constraints.

item.title: Two as one: when scientists run a lab together
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 03 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02938-2

Leading a lab is both a venture and an adventure. It’s double that for these researchers.

item.title: C-COMPASS: a user-friendly neural network tool profiles cell compartments at protein and lipid levels
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02880-3

C-COMPASS is an open-source software designed to predict the spatial cellular distribution of proteins and lipids from cellular organelle profiling using a neural network-based regression model.

item.title: Latent space-based network analysis for brain–behavior linking in neuroimaging
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02896-9

LatentSNA is a method for network analysis in human neuroimaging. It facilitates linking neural activity with behavior and improves biomarker prediction by reducing type II errors.

item.title: Deep Imputation for Skeleton data (DISK) for behavioral science
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02893-y

Analysis of behavioral data often involves tracking animal keypoints in video and motion capture recordings. DISK imputes missing keypoints, thereby improving downstream analyses.

item.title: Unlocking the potential of X-rays to scale up tissue ultrastructure mapping
item.description:
Nature Methods, Published online: 04 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02892-z

Nondestructively mapping biological tissues in 3D with nanoscale detail is essential to scale up the study of how cells interact in their environment, such as in neuronal circuits. We resolved such ultrastructure in brain tissue using coherent X-ray phase-contrast imaging techniques, which extends the volume imaging toolbox with nondestructive approaches.
